title: Zeno is crowned as co-emperor of the Byzantine Empire.[1]
text: Zeno is crowned as co-emperor of the Byzantine Empire.[1]

title: The Northern Han Kingdom is founded by Liu Chong in modern-day Shanxi.[citation needed]
text: The Northern Han Kingdom is founded by Liu Chong in modern-day Shanxi.[citation needed]

title: Boleslaus III is restored to authority with armed support from Bolesław I the Brave of Poland.
text: Boleslaus III is restored to authority with armed support from Bolesław I the Brave of Poland.

title: Bishop of Gloucester John Hooper is burned at the stake.[2]
text: Bishop of Gloucester John Hooper is burned at the stake.[2]

title: Gregory XV becomes Pope, the last Pope elected by acclamation.[3]
text: Gregory XV becomes Pope, the last Pope elected by acclamation.[3]

title: The Capture of Fort Rocher takes place during the Anglo-Spanish War.[4]
text: The Capture of Fort Rocher takes place during the Anglo-Spanish War.[4]

title: American Revolutionary War: The British Parliament declares Massachusetts in rebellion.[5]
text: American Revolutionary War: The British Parliament declares Massachusetts in rebellion.[5]

title: The Habsburg Empire joins the Russo-Turkish War in the Russian camp.
text: The Habsburg Empire joins the Russo-Turkish War in the Russian camp.

title: After no candidate receives a majority of electoral votes in the US presidential election of 1824, the United States House of Representatives elects John Quincy Adams as President of the United States.
text: After no candidate receives a majority of electoral votes in the US presidential election of 1824, the United States House of Representatives elects John Quincy Adams as President of the United States.

title: The new Roman Republic is declared.
text: The new Roman Republic is declared.

title: American Civil War: Jefferson Davis is elected the Provisional President of the Confederate States of America by the Confederate convention at Montgomery, Alabama.
text: American Civil War: Jefferson Davis is elected the Provisional President of the Confederate States of America by the Confederate convention at Montgomery, Alabama.

title: US president Ulysses S. Grant signs a joint resolution of Congress establishing the U.S. Weather Bureau.
text: US president Ulysses S. Grant signs a joint resolution of Congress establishing the U.S. Weather Bureau.

title: US president Grover Cleveland signs a bill elevating the United States Department of Agriculture to a Cabinet-level agency.
text: US president Grover Cleveland signs a bill elevating the United States Department of Agriculture to a Cabinet-level agency.

title: William G. Morgan creates a game called Mintonette, which soon comes to be referred to as volleyball.
text: William G. Morgan creates a game called Mintonette, which soon comes to be referred to as volleyball.

title: The Davis Cup competition is established.
text: The Davis Cup competition is established.

title: Russo-Japanese War: Battle of Port Arthur concludes.
text: Russo-Japanese War: Battle of Port Arthur concludes.

title: The Mud March is the first large procession organised by the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies (NUWSS).
text: The Mud March is the first large procession organised by the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies (NUWSS).

title: A group of meteors is visible across much of the eastern seaboard of North and South America, leading astronomers to conclude the source had been a small, short-lived natural satellite of the Earth.
text: A group of meteors is visible across much of the eastern seaboard of North and South America, leading astronomers to conclude the source had been a small, short-lived natural satellite of the Earth.

title: Under the terms of the Svalbard Treaty, international diplomacy recognizes Norwegian sovereignty over Arctic archipelago Svalbard, and designates it as demilitarized.
text: Under the terms of the Svalbard Treaty, international diplomacy recognizes Norwegian sovereignty over Arctic archipelago Svalbard, and designates it as demilitarized.

title: Brazil becomes a member of the Berne Convention copyright treaty.
text: Brazil becomes a member of the Berne Convention copyright treaty.

title: The Balkan Entente is formed.
text: The Balkan Entente is formed.

title: World War II: The Cathedral of San Lorenzo in Genoa, Italy is struck by a bomb which fails to detonate.
text: World War II: The Cathedral of San Lorenzo in Genoa, Italy is struck by a bomb which fails to detonate.

title: World War II: Top United States military leaders hold their first formal meeting to discuss American military strategy in the war.
text: World War II: Top United States military leaders hold their first formal meeting to discuss American military strategy in the war.

title: Year-round Daylight saving time aka War Time is re-instated in the United States as a wartime measure to help conserve energy resources. [6]
text: Year-round Daylight saving time aka War Time is re-instated in the United States as a wartime measure to help conserve energy resources. [6]

title: World War II: Allied authorities declare Guadalcanal secure after Imperial Japan evacuates its remaining forces from the island, ending the Battle of Guadalcanal.
text: World War II: Allied authorities declare Guadalcanal secure after Imperial Japan evacuates its remaining forces from the island, ending the Battle of Guadalcanal.

title: World War II: Battle of the Atlantic: HMS Venturer sinks U-864 off the coast of Fedje, Norway, in a rare instance of submarine-to-submarine combat.
text: World War II: Battle of the Atlantic: HMS Venturer sinks U-864 off the coast of Fedje, Norway, in a rare instance of submarine-to-submarine combat.

title: World War II: A force of Allied aircraft unsuccessfully attacked a German destroyer in Førdefjorden, Norway.
text: World War II: A force of Allied aircraft unsuccessfully attacked a German destroyer in Førdefjorden, Norway.

title: Second Red Scare: US Senator Joseph McCarthy accuses the United States Department of State of being filled with Communists.
text: Second Red Scare: US Senator Joseph McCarthy accuses the United States Department of State of being filled with Communists.

title: Korean War: The two-day Geochang massacre begins as a battalion of the 11th Division of the South Korean Army kills 719 unarmed citizens in Geochang, in the South Gyeongsang district of South Korea
text: Korean War: The two-day Geochang massacre begins as a battalion of the 11th Division of the South Korean Army kills 719 unarmed citizens in Geochang, in the South Gyeongsang district of South Korea

title: The R-7 Semyorka, the first intercontinental ballistic missile, becomes operational at Plesetsk, USSR.
text: The R-7 Semyorka, the first intercontinental ballistic missile, becomes operational at Plesetsk, USSR.

title: The Beatles make their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show, performing before a "record-busting" audience of 73 million viewers across the USA.
text: The Beatles make their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show, performing before a "record-busting" audience of 73 million viewers across the USA.

title: The United States Marine Corps sends a MIM-23 Hawk missile battalion to South Vietnam, the first American troops in-country without an official advisory or training mission.
text: The United States Marine Corps sends a MIM-23 Hawk missile battalion to South Vietnam, the first American troops in-country without an official advisory or training mission.

title: The 6.5–6.7 Mw Sylmar earthquake hits the Greater Los Angeles Area with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing 64 and injuring 2,000.
text: The 6.5–6.7 Mw Sylmar earthquake hits the Greater Los Angeles Area with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing 64 and injuring 2,000.

title: Satchel Paige becomes the first Negro League player to be voted into the USA's Baseball Hall of Fame.
text: Satchel Paige becomes the first Negro League player to be voted into the USA's Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Apollo program: Apollo 14 returns to Earth after the third manned Moon landing.
text: Apollo program: Apollo 14 returns to Earth after the third manned Moon landing.

title: The Soyuz 17 Soviet spacecraft returns to Earth.
text: The Soyuz 17 Soviet spacecraft returns to Earth.

title: The Budd Company unveils its first SPV-2000 self-propelled railcar in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
text: The Budd Company unveils its first SPV-2000 self-propelled railcar in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Halley's Comet last appeared in the inner Solar System.
text: Halley's Comet last appeared in the inner Solar System.

title: Voters in Lithuania vote for independence.
text: Voters in Lithuania vote for independence.

title: The Provisional Irish Republican Army declares the end to its 18-month ceasefire and explodes a large bomb in London's Canary Wharf, killing two people.
text: The Provisional Irish Republican Army declares the end to its 18-month ceasefire and explodes a large bomb in London's Canary Wharf, killing two people.

title: Copernicium is first discovered.
text: Copernicium is first discovered.

title: Two passenger trains collided in the German town of Bad Aibling in the state of Bavaria. Twelve people died, and 85 others were injured.
text: Two passenger trains collided in the German town of Bad Aibling in the state of Bavaria. Twelve people died, and 85 others were injured.

title: 2018 Winter Olympics : opening ceremony is performed in Pyeongchang County in South Korea.
